reviewText: Good story, good acting, a step above a B movie, action packed, a touch of drama
disappointed. Not as good as her previous movies

Sean (Christopher Atkins) is a police detective. His partner gets killed in a drug deal bust gone bad. Criminal Billy (Costas Mandylor) pulled the trigger. He also blames Detective Barnett (Michael Leon) who was supposed to be there. Sean quits the force and goes live on a ranch. Billy escapes from prison and goes on a crime revenge rampage.

The action scenes are mostly quick and light. The story lacks depth and character. The film is currently making the rounds in action multi film collections at Walmart, perhaps the best and cheapest way to own it.

Parental Guide: F-bomb, sex, nudity (Nicole LeVoy, Angela Lavalle ?) 2 1/2 stars
this movie was ok not real bad but in some spots could be better real all in all  a good movie

Everyone expect action every five minutes. As soon as there is a conversation of more than five seconds we get " slow movie". I say "rubbish" This movie is great, full of action, acting is good to very good. The plot may be a little typical but you are still on the edge of the seat!

This is one of the worst movies I have ever seen...do not waste your time or money on it.  Acting was horrific, plot was terrible, it just was awful.  I'm only giving it a star b/c this site makes me select at least one.  It doesn't even deserve a half..
If you love Costas Mandylor, you have to see this movie. The plot is slow at times, but it is still a decent movie. Costas Mandylor makes for a good evil character.
